articles.title: JPMorgan Retains Its Top Acquiring Spot in TSG’s Annual Review
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has maintained its position as the top merchant acquirer in TSG’s annual review for 2023, processing an estimated $2.4 trillion. While the top three spots remain similar, with Fiserv and Worldpay following, other acquirers like Stripe Inc. saw significant movement, jumping from ninth to sixth place. The stability at the top is attributed to the continued dominance of major players and a less active year for consolidation in the payments space.

articles.title: JPMorgan Taps Global X's Jon Maier as Chief ETF Strategist
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase’s asset management division has appointed Jon Maier as its first chief ETF strategist. Maier, formerly the chief investment officer at Global X ETFs, is known for his expertise in selecting funds for Merrill Lynch’s investment portfolios. In his new role, Maier will lead JPMorgan’s new ETF Insights platform, focusing on producing research and content for investors and advisers.

articles.title: Truist Insurance Wraps $6.1 Billion Bond, Loan Sale for LBO
articles.summary: Truist Insurance has successfully completed a $6.1 billion bond and loan sale to finance its leveraged buyout, with a group of debt arrangers led by Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase & Co. The financing included $3 billion in high-yield bonds and a $3.1 billion leveraged loan, supporting the acquisition by Stone Point Capital and Clayton Dubilier & Rice of Truist Financial Corp.’s insurance business. The bond sale was the final component of the financing package.

articles.title: BlackRock launches U.S. equity ETFs with covered-call strategies as option-based funds surge
articles.summary: BlackRock is introducing two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that utilize covered-call strategies on U.S. equities, targeting a growing segment of the ETF market. The iShares S&P 500 BuyWrite ETF (IVVW) will focus on large-cap stocks, while the iShares Russell 2000 BuyWrite ETF (IWMW) will target small-cap stocks. These new funds are set to begin trading on Friday, catering to broadening investor interest in option-based ETFs.

articles.title: BlackRock launches U.S. equity ETFs with covered-call strategies as option-based funds surge
articles.summary: BlackRock has launched two new U.S. equity exchange-traded funds (ETFs) utilizing covered-call strategies, reflecting the growing popularity of option-based funds. These new ETFs, the iShares S&P 500 BuyWrite ETF (IVVW) and the iShares Russell 2000 BuyWrite ETF (IWMW), will focus on large-cap and small-cap stocks, respectively, and began trading on March 15, 2024. This move comes as the U.S. equity market, particularly the S&P 500, has seen significant gains this year.

articles.title: BlackRock hires GSR research analyst who predicted 75% chance of spot ether ETF approval by May
articles.summary: BlackRock has hired former GSR research analyst Matt Kunke as a director and product strategist for iShares digital assets ETFs. Kunke previously predicted a 75% chance of spot Ethereum ETF approval by May, an optimistic outlook shared by BlackRock, which has also applied for a spot Ethereum ETF. BlackRock's IBIT Bitcoin ETF has already attracted significant investment, demonstrating the firm's leadership in crypto ETFs.

articles.title: Des performances annuelles au-delà des 10 % pour les meilleurs fonds obligataires datés
articles.summary: The article highlights the strong annual performance of certain dated bond funds, with the best ones exceeding 10% returns. It explains that these funds, which invest in bonds held until maturity, have benefited significantly from rising interest rates since 2022, offering an attractive risk/return ratio. A table is provided listing various dated bond funds, their ISIN codes, net asset values, and year-on-year performance.

articles.title: Millennial And Gen Z Borrowers Climb The Credit Tier Ladder
articles.summary: A new study from Open Lending and TransUnion reveals that 30% of millennials and Gen Zers advanced in credit tiers within the last two years, outperforming older consumers. Despite being "thin-file borrowers," this demographic shows significant potential for upward credit mobility and customer loyalty. Financial institutions that intelligently cater to these "emerging prime" borrowers through data analysis can unlock higher-yielding loan opportunities and long-term customer relationships.

articles.title: FB Roundup: Joao Moreira Salles, Joe Lewis, Michael Dell
articles.summary: This FB Roundup covers the Moreira Salles family office boosting its AUM to nearly $11 billion, Joe Lewis likely avoiding prison time after pleading guilty to fraud, and Michael Dell selling over $465 million worth of Dell Technologies shares. These stories highlight significant financial developments and legal proceedings for prominent family businesses and billionaires.

articles.title: MGV: Large Value Makes More Sense Now
articles.summary: The article suggests a potential sector rotation as momentum favors large caps, but growth large caps show signs of fatigue. It highlights the Vanguard Mega Cap Value ETF (MGV) as a suitable investment for those bullish on large-cap value, noting its diversified portfolio including companies like Berkshire Hathaway and Exxon Mobil. The author, Michael A. Gayed, CFA, discusses his investment philosophy focused on risk-on/risk-off signals.

articles.title: Bryan Armour: Is Index Investing’s Superpower Unstoppable?
articles.summary: Bryan Armour, Morningstar's director of passive investment strategies research, discusses the increasing dominance of index investing and ETFs, the impact of bitcoin ETFs, and the future challenges for active management. He highlights the cost advantages of passive investing, the growth of actively managed ETFs, and offers insights into various ETF trends, including covered calls and thematic funds, as well as the unique aspects of direct indexing and Vanguard's stance on bitcoin ETFs.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley’s ETFs Break $1 Billion With Mutual Fund Flips
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley's exchange-traded fund lineup has surpassed $1 billion in assets due to the firm's first-ever mutual fund conversions. The firm converted two fixed-income mutual funds from Eaton Vance into ETFs, bringing its total ETF offerings to 14. This move underscores Morgan Stanley's commitment to expanding its presence in the competitive $9 trillion ETF market, particularly in active, fixed-income ETFs.

articles.title: BlackRock launches U.S. equity ETFs with covered-call strategies as option-based funds surge
articles.summary: BlackRock is introducing two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that utilize covered-call strategies on U.S. equities, focusing on large-cap and small-cap stocks. This move comes as investor adoption of option-based ETFs continues to grow, reflecting a hot area in the ETF market. The iShares S&P 500 BuyWrite ETF (IVVW) and the iShares Russell 2000 BuyWrite ETF (IWMW) are set to begin trading, offering investors new tools in their portfolios.

articles.title: Emerging Market Opportunities Outside of China: Views From the Middle East
articles.summary: This article highlights the significant, yet often overlooked, investment opportunities in the Middle East & North Africa (MENA) region. It discusses MENA's economic diversification efforts beyond oil and gas, its attractive equity market valuations, and its potential to become a more significant part of the MSCI Emerging Markets Index. The author also points out the region's strong growth prospects compared to other emerging markets like Latin America and its strategic positioning as an alternative to China, especially given its growing an underappreciated connection with India.

articles.title: BlackRock launches U.S. equity ETFs with covered-call strategies as option-based funds surge
articles.summary: BlackRock is introducing two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that utilize covered-call strategies on U.S. equities, focusing on large-cap and small-cap stocks. This move comes as investor adoption of option-based ETFs continues to grow, reflecting a hot area of the ETF market. The new funds, iShares S&P 500 BuyWrite ETF (IVVW) and iShares Russell 2000 BuyWrite ETF (IWMW), are set to begin trading on Friday.

articles.title: BlackRock launches U.S. equity ETFs with covered-call strategies as option-based funds surge
articles.summary: BlackRock is introducing two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) utilizing covered-call strategies on U.S. equities, focusing on both large-cap and small-cap stocks. This move comes as investor adoption of option-based ETFs continues to expand. The iShares S&P 500 BuyWrite ETF (IVVW) and the iShares Russell 2000 BuyWrite ETF (IWMW) are set to begin trading on Friday.

articles.title: Advocates urge transparency in Capital One-Discover review
articles.summary: Over 30 advocacy organizations are calling for increased transparency in the federal review of Capital One's proposed $35.3 billion acquisition of Discover Financial Services. They urge regulators to avoid an expedited review, extend public comment periods, and hold public hearings in key markets due to concerns about the deal's potential impact on consumers, merchants, and market power. Lawmakers and regulators have also expressed scrutiny regarding the merger's antitrust implications and potential anticompetitive effects.

articles.title: Empire State Realty Trust Announces $715 Million Credit Facility
articles.summary: Empire State Realty Trust, Inc. announced its operating partnership has secured a new $715 million credit facility, comprising a $620 million revolving credit facility and a $95 million term loan facility. This new facility replaces existing ones maturing in March 2025 and includes a sustainability-linked pricing mechanism. The move aims to maintain strong liquidity and extend balance sheet flexibility, supporting stakeholder value generation.

articles.title: PAR Technology Acquires Convenience-Store Digital Engagement Platform Provider Stuzo
articles.summary: PAR Technology has acquired convenience-store and retail fuel software provider Stuzo Holdings LLC for approximately $190 million in cash and stock. This acquisition strengthens PAR's business by expanding its market into the convenience foodservice sector and enhancing its product and service offerings globally. Additionally, PAR has entered into an agreement to acquire Australia-based foodservice transaction platform TASK Group for approximately $206 million, further broadening its international reach and product portfolio.

articles.title: What Does USAA’s Investment Business Sale Mean for You
articles.summary: USAA sold its investment businesses to Victory Capital and Schwab in 2019. This article explains why USAA made this decision, how it affects USAA members' investments, and the benefits of the transition, including expected lower expenses and enhanced customer service from Victory Capital and Schwab.

articles.title: BlackRock's Fink deserves a standing ovation, Galaxy Digital CEO says
articles.summary: The CEO of Galaxy Digital stated that BlackRock's Larry Fink deserves a standing ovation for his work, specifically mentioning it in the context of a bitcoin event. This article appears within a section discussing Exchange Traded Funds and also includes other featured stories related to institutional investing.
